topics.body:
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552701976368726772a40100#post_552701976368726772a40100
Why not?  If you reprogram it's genetic structure to not be rejected it would function just the same.  Your options at that point are to either live on pacemakers or to get a replacement heart.


INB4 someone goes, "durr hurr technology is the devil and thomas edison was a witch and millions of people deserve to die to preserve my morals"

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552703af6368721e518d0400#post_552703af6368721e518d0400
Because a presentation I was watching the other day about neo-luddism pointed out how the main problem with society was the idea that sacrificing life is worth it to preserve morality.  Well it started talking about vaccines and pig heart transplants and went into how society is rejecting life saving technology.  If I'm not mistaken the total figure of deaths due to people rejecting medical treatment or forcing others to not have medical treatment due to the idea that it "violated" their morals came out to be somewhere around a estimated 12 million deaths either through stopping people from being able to receive medical treatments or such.

The most shocking example of this is that a couple decades back a country in africa rejected the polio vaccine after a push by the anti-vaccine movement and as a result there was a massive outbreak that killed a lot of people.

Another example of this is that we currently have medication to stop the spread of HIV from one person to another and people are outright refusing to take it even if their spouse is known to have HIV.

Saying that people reject pig heart transplants due to ideology isn't that much a stretch considering that pig hearts and grown organs are receiving all kinds of backlash from individuals that believe the technologies are against their beliefs.

Another example of this was that there was a case a couple months ago that was all over the news where two parents rejected cancer therapy for their child calling it a obstruction of their religious beliefs, but the judge ruled that religious freedom doesn't extend to preventing your children from receiving life saving treatment.  Now the kid is okay and the cancer is in remission.


Tl:dr; the neo-luddite movement is gaining a lot of ground and as a result a lot of people are dying due to rejecting medical treatment or preventing others from receiving medical treatment.


Also last time I talked about 3d printed organs on here there was a massive fight with someone saying that 3d printed organs should be banned.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552707ab6368720b7a921200#post_552707ab6368720b7a921200
Fun little vignette. Me and granddad were at the grocery store and we came across packages pf Pulled Pork. So I look over at granddad and go "Granddad, how exactly does one pull pork." And he looks at me with a straight face and says "Well in privacy of you don't wanna get arrested." We then proceeded to laugh our asses off for a good three minutes in full view of everyone in the store. I am convinced that everyone who saw us thought we were insane.
